Articles.Content:
I think I accidentally deleted an essential folder in GameData when uninstalling some mods. Either the deletion of a file, or a strange bug is causing this. Just in case, I'd like a copy of the stock GameData files if possible. If not, i would like to know how to go about fixing this. Thanks plenty!

Here are some screenies of the issues:

[http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922789](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922789)

[http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922819](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922819)

[http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922845](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=433922845)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T22:59:10Z" title="04/28/2015 10:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by Silverfishstix**
  
Added Links to Images of Missing Textures

You can obtain a copy of the gamedata folder by unzipping the download if you download from the KSP store, or by verifying your steam installation if you are on steam. Worst come to worst back up your save and re-install the game. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> You can obtain a copy of the gamedata folder by unzipping the download if you download from the KSP store, or by verifying your steam installation if you are on steam. Worst come to worst back up your save and re-install the game. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Kind of a dumb question, but, verify steam installation? How would I go about doing that? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

It's called "Verify Integrity of Game Cache." [Details here](https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It's called "Verify Integrity of Game Cache." [Details here](https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks, but it seems that it hasn't restored any deleted files or anything. The missing textures are still there. I bet there's a mod that's goofing all this up.

Edit: Nope. Not a mod that's causing all this mayhem. I'll need some sort of access to the actual GameData files. Nothing has worked as of yet. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T03:06:23Z" title="04/29/2015 03:06  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by Silverfishstix**
  
Added Info
I have this exact same issue on the unmodified game.
